title: Wait to connect to ZK in gobblin.yarn.GobblinYarnAppLauncherTest.setUp()

I see frequent test failures on Travis which cannot be reproduced locally. I suspect it might be a race condition when starting/connecting to ZK. I've added an explicit wait to connect to gobblin.yarn.GobblinYarnAppLauncherTest to see if that will help.

title: Adding Container Metrics for gobblin-yarn
body:
- YARN containers were not reporting any Task Level Metrics (e.g. records extracted, records written, bytes written, etc.) because Metrics Reporting was not enabled in the containers
- Added `ContainerMetrics.java` to handle metrics reporting for each YARN container
- The metrics hierarchy is as follows `ContainerMetrics` -> `JobMetrics` -> `TaskMetrics`
- A `JobMetrics` instance is obtained in each `GobblinHelixTask`
- Unlike `MRJobLauncher` where the `JobMetrics` instance is manually removed from the `GobblinMetricsRegistry`, `GobblinHelixTask` does not remove the `JobMetrics` instance at the end of each task because there may be more tasks in the container that need the `JobMetrics` instance
- Reporting is done on the `ContainerMetrics` instance
- Testing is still in progress

@liyinan926 and @ibuenros can you review?

title: Improved Yarn container fault tolerance handling
body:
1. Added an option to use the same host as the preferred host when requesting a replacement container.
2. The Helix instance names of containers are now controlled and assigned by the ApplicationMaster, which maintains a fixed set of Helix instance names that get reused for replacement containers.
3. Added support to stop attempts on requesting a replacement container for a Helix instance if the retry count of the instance has reached the maximum.
4. Note that we don't measure how soon a Helix instance fails and stop retries if it's too soon, as Samza does. The reason is container failures in our case will mostly not be due to job/task issues and may be very likely transient. Even if a container fails consecutively really fast due to persistent issues, e.g., node failures, the system will stop retries after the maximum of retries gets reached anyway.

Signed-off-by: Yinan Li liyinan926@gmail.com

title: Resolve race condition between writer and metric updater
body:
There is a race condition between `FsDataWriter.addRecordCountToFileName()` and `AvroHdfsDataWriter.bytesWritten()`. Between `if (!this.fs.exists(this.outputFile))` and `return this.fs.getFileStatus(this.outputFile).getLen()`, the output file could be renamed (adding row count to file name). Adding synchronization to resolve this. 

Also, reset `this.outputFile` to new path after renaming.

title: ETL-3803: remove "topic" from gobblin-compaction so that gobblin-compaction no longer requires a topic name, but just input/output path..
body:
Currently gobblin-compaction has a specific way of defining topics and datasets: the user specifies a "compaction.input.dir" property, e.g., /data/tracking, then each subfolder under "compaction.input.dir" is considered a "topic", and it is up to MRCompactorJobPropCreator to determine what are the "datasets" for each topic, e.g., /data/tracking/PVE/hourly/2015/11/15 is a dataset for topic PVE. A compaction job will run on each dataset.

Many use cases don't fit in the scenario where each subfolder under "compaction.input.dir" should be considered a topic (e.g., maybe the user just want to deduplicate /user/xyz/data). Moreover, "topic" is a Kafka-specific concept.

Given the existence of dataset, "topic" should be no longer be used. MRCompactorJobPropCreator should directly find datasets given "compaction.input.dir". This PR added `DatasetsFinder` to find compaction datasets with input/output path information. `SimpleDatasetsFinder` treats "compaction.input.dir" as one single dataset for compaction. `TimeBasedSubDirDatasetsFinder` will be used to find datasets under "compaction.input.dir" in the form of [compaction.input.dir]/[subdir]/[compaction.timebased.folder.pattern].

@zliu41 Can you review?

This PR fixes it by having `getLauncherType()` return `LOCAL` if the job launcher name is not found in `JobLauncherType`.

1. Added schema registry to `KafkaAvroExtractor`, since people are using Confluent's schema registry. It is not mandatory, and if one doesn't want to use schema registry, she needs to override `getExtractorSchema()` and get the schema in her own way.
2. Changed `KafkaSchemaRegistry` from interface to abstract class, and moved some code over from `KafkaAvroSchemaRegistry` (mainly the loading cache part), which can be reused by other implementations of schema registry.

title: Add support for reconnecting to running Yarn app after driver restart
body:
1. Added support to `GobblinYarnAppLauncher` to be able to reconnect after restart to the Yarn application it launched previously. The way it works is straightforward: upon starting, it checks if a file storing the previous Yarn application ID exists, and if so, it reads the previous application ID and checks if the ID matches any active Yarn application. If so, it simply starts the application state monitor. Otherwise, it submits a new application and persist the application ID. 
2. Switched to `MetricRegistry` for JVM metrics in `GobblinApplicationMaster` and `GobblinWorkUnitRunner` since `MetricContext` no longer supports registering Dropwizard metric instances.
3. Added some unit tests. More to come once I figure out how to test the parts that interact with Yarn and Helix.

Signed-off-by: Yinan Li liyinan926@gmail.com

title: Generalize and abstract KafkaAvroExtractor
body:
Currently `KafkaAvroExtractor` requires a specific implementation of the schema registry, as well as a specific format of the Kafka record payload (first byte = 0, next 16 bytes are schema ID, remaining bytes are the record). It is not applicable anywhere else outside LinkedIn.

This PR generalizes it and makes it an abstract class.

Also created an interface `KafkaSchemaRegistry` which can be implemented in different ways.

Due to some recent changes to `FsDataWriter` and its subclasses, `FsDataWriter` will throw an `FileNotFoundException` if a group is specified and it tries to set the group on the staging output file, which won't be created until later in the constructor of `AvroHdfsDataWriter` and `SimpleDataWriter`. Attempt to set group on a file that does not exist will throw an `FileNotFoundException`.

title: Add option to use prime number of reducers in compaction
body:
Add an option to use a prime number of reducers for compaction, which is less subject to hashcode skew.

Also changed the default data size a reducers processes from 256M to 512M, which brings the number of reducers a job uses more in-line with Camus.

repo.name: gobblin

title: Improve topic isolation in MRCompactor
body:
Previously if the MR compaction job for a topic fails it won't affect other topics, but if it fails when creating job properties for a topic or submitting the topic to the job executor, the whole job will fail immediately and no other topic will be processed.

This PR fixes it -- in the above cases the topic will be skipped without affecting other topics.

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Fixed Gobblin Yarn to be able to run MultiWorkUnits
body:
Originally Gobblin on Yarn was written with the assumption that we would rely on Helix to group/pack `WorkUnit`s into groups and assign them properly to the available containers. So the code originally flattened the `MultiWorkUnit`s. Later it was realized this would not be too practical since Helix does not have the knowledge of loads of individual `WorkUnit`s. In addition, the Gobblin Kafka adapter is already doing bin packing so we decided to not override that logic and changed the code to not flatten `MultiWorkUnit`s. However, the parts that actually run the job/tasks are not updated accordingly to work with `MultiWorkUnit`s. This PR fixed it. 

Signed-off-by: Yinan Li liyinan926@gmail.com

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Bug fixes to sftp copy
body:
The pr has some bug fixes to sftp copy. 
@ibuenros can you review?
Tested on both MR mode and local mode

**Bugs/improvements**
1. SftpFsHelper - Added support to read private key file from HDFS for password-less sftp connection
2.  SftpLightWeightFileSystem.java - 
   - Removed scheme and authority from paths since jsch expects raw path strings. 
   - Create a new sftp filesystem each time instead of cached copy. (Note that new instance is created only for sftp file system. Other fs still use cached copy). In the continuous execution model, multiple jobs can run in the same container/jvm. If a cached copy is used per jvm, an authenticated session created by one job will be used by another job.
3. CopySource.java - CopyableDataset was incorrectly serialized in SourceState instead of WorkUnitStates. **_Already have test for this**_
4. FileAwareInputStreamDataWriterBuilder.java - Use job specific task-staging and task-output directories. Previously the task-ouput and task-staging paths were /some/path/gobblin/task-staging and /some/path/gobblin/task-output. Not the path will be /some/path/gobblin/task-staging/job_id and /some/path/gobblin/task-output/job_id **_Already have test for this**_
   This is make sure uncleaned data from previous execution will not affect the current execution.
5. ConfigurableGlobDatasetFinder.java - Deprecated config key gobblin.cleanable.dataset.pattern in favor of gobblin.dataset.pattern **_Already have test for this. See copy.pull**_
6. HadoopUtils.java - For rename operations, some file systems do not create the necessary parent directories at the destination. Fixed that. **_Already have test for this**_

@sahilTakiar can you review 1 and 2

title: Part2 sftp copy
body:
This is part 2 of https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/403

Tasks from meeting, 
1. Use password encryption for SFTP creds and decryption passphrase - Done
2. Open ticket to explore unarchival in converter - Done
3. Rename archive..writer to Tar..writer or support other archival types in archive writer -  Done
4. Implement permission -  Done
5. Add preserver flags (group, owner, permission) to job config -  Will be done in config package
6. split pull request to Dataset, Copyable Dataset, SFTP -  Done

I have added support to handle multiple datasets in the writer and the publisher. The task staging and task output now have the complete path of the final destination under them. 
The publisher goes over each dataset in the task out put and publishes them.
##### E.g.

Source FileSystem
/src/a/b/c /t1.txt
/src/a/b/c /t2.txt

Let's say /src/a/b/c needs to be copied to /dest/data/a/b/c,
##### After InputStreamDataWriter.write

Gobblin's task staging directory looks like,
-/tmp/gobblin/task_staging/task_Id1/dest/data/a/b/c/t1.txt
-/tmp/gobblin/task_staging/task_Id2/dest/data/a/b/c/t2.txt
##### After InputStreamDataWriter.commit

Gobblin's task output directory looks like,
-/tmp/gobblin/task_output/dest/data/a/b/c/t1.txt
-/tmp/gobblin/task_output/dest/data/a/b/c/t2.txt
##### Note that the commit method accumulates directory paths under multiple task staging directories to one task output directory. This will make sure parallel mapper task DO NOT overwrite directories created by another mapper.
##### After CopyDataPublisher.publish

Destination FileSystem looks like,
/dest/data/a/b/c/t1.txt
/dest/data/a/b/c/t2.txt

Each dataset is renamed at a time by the publisher. In this case /dest/data.

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Do not override `MultiWorkUnit` grouping in Gobblin Yarn
body:
Currently, the `GobblinHelixJobLauncher` flattens `MultiWorkUnit`s and hope for Helix to do a balanced assignments of tasks to containers. However, both Gobblin Kafka and IDPC HDFS Purger already have their own logic of grouping `WorkUnit`s into `MultiWorkUnit`s. It's good to keep their logic and not to override it.

Signed-off-by: Yinan Li liyinan926@gmail.com

repo.name: gobblin

title: Add option to set max time ago for AvroHdfsTimePartitionedWriter
body:
Records older than max allowed time ago will be dropped.

Currently there's no limit, and we had situations where some Kafka partitions contain records in thousands of hours, which caused the mapper to OOM.

There is a similar property in Camus.

repo.name: gobblin

title: Hive SerDe support
body:
1. Added a `Source`, an `Extractor`, a `Converter` and a `DataWriter` for supporting Hive SerDes.
2. Moved `stagingFileOutputStream` out of `FsDataWriter`, since Hive SerDes use `RecordWriter` to write data to staging files, which may fail if there is already an open `stagingFileOutputStream`.

Tested with Avro serde in and Orc serde out.

repo.name: gobblin
repo.description: A distributed data integration framework that simplifies common aspects of big data integration such as data ingestion, replication, organization and lifecycle management for both streaming and batch data ecosystems.

title: Fixed an issue that may cause Kafka adapter to miss data if the Fork fails
body:
1. Introduced a new `JobCommitPolicy.COMMIT_SUCCESSFUL_TASKS` that will only commit successful tasks. This is recommended to be used with jobs with task-level data publishing so tasks can control independently if their output data should be published.
2. Updated `KafkaExtractor` to skip updating the actual high watermark if the `WorkUnit` fails.
3. Used a `ExecutorCompletionService` to run `Fork`s of a `Task` and for waiting for the `Fork`s to finish, instead of a `CountDownLatch`.
4. Other code factoring.

Signed-off-by: Yinan Li liyinan926@gmail.com
